titles.title: Affirming the obligation and leadership of the United States to improve the lives of the 35,900,000 Americans living in poverty and an additional 15,300,000 Americans living in extreme poverty.
Affirming the obligation and leadership of the United States to improve the lives of the 35,900,000 Americans living in poverty and an additional 15,300,000 Americans living in extreme poverty.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.

bill.summary: Directs the President to present a plan immediately to eradicate poverty by 2010.
